required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether anodal transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) applied to the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex induces approach motivation, and whether anodal tDCS applied to the right dorsolateral prefrontal cortex induces avoidance motivation. This study consists of three experiments: one in which an approach/avoidance video game is validated, one in which the effect of anger and fear on approach/avoidance is studied, and one in which the effect of tDCS is studied. Only the experiment in which the effect of tDCS is studied involves tDCS.

primary_outcome.description: Median of the difference between time to approach and time to avoid a stimulus

arm_group.arm_group_label: Anodal left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex tDCS stimulation
Anodal right dorsolateral prefrontal cortex tDCS stimulation

intervention.intervention_name: Anodal left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex tDCS stimulation
intervention.description: Anodal tDCS will be applied to the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex of participants
intervention.arm_group_label: Anodal left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex tDCS stimulation

intervention.intervention_name: Anodal right dorsolateral prefrontal cortex tDCS stimulation
intervention.description: Anodal tDCS will be applied to the right dorsolateral prefrontal cortex of participants
intervention.arm_group_label: Anodal right dorsolateral prefrontal cortex tDCS stimulation

intervention.description: Sham tDCS stimulation will be applied

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Normal hearing and vision
Exclusion Criteria:
- Left-handedness
- History of seizure, head injury (including neurosurgery), brain injury, diagnosis or a neurological or psychiatric disorder, metal in the head, sensitive scalp
- History of anxiolytic and/or antidepressant medications
- Participation in Experiment #1 or Experiment #2 of the larger study

facility.name: Center for Applied Brain and Cognitive Sciences
